conclusion: Identify the given information: laser beam travels from point A to point C, transparent brick is semi-cylindrical with radius r, refractive index n, speed of light v.
Laser beam travels from point A to point C, path of light is a straight line, speed of light in vacuum is v.
Using properties of a semi-cylinder, distance AC is the circumference of the semi-circle, radius r of the semi-circle is r.
Arc length s of the semi-circle is given by s = 2πr.
Time taken for the beam to travel from A to C is Time = s/v = 2πr/v.
Time taken for the beam to travel from A to C is also the time it takes for light to travel from A to C through the transparent brick: Time = 2πr/v.
Since the laser beam travels at speed v, the time taken for the beam to travel from A to C is Time = 2πr/v.
